member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.DaysViewSettings.AllDayMoreAppointmentsIndicatorTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template that is used to display the more appointments indicator view in the day, week, and workweek views of all day appointment view panel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.DaysViewSettings.AllDayAppointmentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets all day appointment template to change the default UI of appointment.
member.example:
The following sample used to configure the custom appointments and all day appointment template. # [Model.cs](#tab/tabid-1)
public class Meeting { public string EventName { get; set; } public DateTime From { get; set; } public DateTime To { get; set; } public bool IsAllDay { get; set; } public Brush BackgroundBrush { get; set; } }
# [ViewModel.cs](#tab/tabid-2)
var customAppointments = new ObservableCollection<Meeting>(); var meeting = new Meeting() { EventName = "General Meeting", From = new DateTime(2020, 11, 25, 09, 0, 0), To = new DateTime(2020, 11, 25, 10, 0, 0), BackgroundBrush = new SolidColorBrush((Color)ColorConverter.ConvertFromString("#FFA2C139")), }; customAppointments.Add(meeting); this.scheduler.ItemsSource = customAppointments;
# [MainWindow](#tab/tabid-3)
<Window.Resources> <DataTemplate x:Key="alldayAppointmentTemplate"> <StackPanel Background = "{Binding Data.BackgroundBrush}" VerticalAlignment="Stretch" HorizontalAlignment="Stretch"> <TextBlock Text = "{Binding Data.EventName}" VerticalAlignment="Center" TextTrimming="CharacterEllipsis" TextWrapping="Wrap" TextAlignment="Left"/> </StackPanel> </DataTemplate> </Window.Resources>
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings AllDayAppointmentTemplate = "{StaticResource alldayAppointmentTemplate}" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentMapping> <syncfusion:AppointmentMapping Subject = "EventName" StartTime="From" EndTime="To" IsAllDay="IsAllDay" AppointmentBackground="BackgroundBrush"/> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentMapping> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>
***

Gets or sets the special time region template to customize the default UI with custom UI in schedule.
This property will be applicable to , , , , and views.
member.example:
The following sample used to configure the special time region template. # [Xaml](#tab/tabid-e)
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings.SpecialTimeRegionTemplate> <DataTemplate > <Grid Background = "{Binding Background}" Opacity="0.5" HorizontalAlignment="Stretch" VerticalAlignment="Stretch" > </Grid> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:DaysViewSettings.SpecialTimeRegionTemplate> </syncfusion:DaysViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings.SpecialTimeRegionTemplate> <DataTemplate > <Grid Background = "{Binding Background}" Opacity="0.5" HorizontalAlignment="Stretch" VerticalAlignment="Stretch" > </Grid> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings.SpecialTimeRegionTemplate> </syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.ViewSettingsBase.AppointmentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the appointment template to change the default UI of appointment.
member.remarks: By default, the is set as the DataContext for for both and custom data object in . Custom data object can be bound in by using .
member.example:
The following sample used to configure the custom appointments and appointment template. #[Model.cs](#tab/tabid-1)
public class Meeting { public string EventName { get; set; } public DateTime From { get; set; } public DateTime To { get; set; } public Brush BackgroundBrush { get; set; } }
#[C#](#tab/tabid-2)
var customAppointments = new ObservableCollection<Meeting>(); var meeting = new Meeting() { EventName = "General Meeting", From = new DateTime(2020, 11, 25, 09, 0, 0), To = new DateTime(2020, 11, 25, 10, 0, 0), BackgroundBrush = new SolidColorBrush((Color)ColorConverter.ConvertFromString("#FFA2C139")), }; customAppointments.Add(meeting); this.scheduler.ItemsSource = this.CustomAppointments;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-3)
<Window.Resources> <DataTemplate x:Key="appointmentTemplate"> <StackPanel Background = "{Binding Data.BackgroundBrush}" VerticalAlignment="Stretch" HorizontalAlignment="Stretch"> <TextBlock Text = "{Binding Data.EventName}" VerticalAlignment="Center" TextTrimming="CharacterEllipsis" TextWrapping="Wrap" TextAlignment="Left"/> </StackPanel> </DataTemplate> </Window.Resources>
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="scheduler"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings AppointmentTemplate = "{StaticResource appointmentTemplate}" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings AppointmentTemplate = "{StaticResource appointmentTemplate}" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings AppointmentTemplate = "{StaticResource appointmentTemplate}" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentMapping> <syncfusion:AppointmentMapping Subject = "EventName" StartTime="From" EndTime="To" AppointmentBackground="BackgroundBrush"/> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentMapping> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.remarks: By default, the is set as the DataContext for for both and custom data object in . Custom data object can be bound in by using .

member.summary: Gets or sets view header day format.

#[C#](#tab/tabid-8)
this.Schedule.DaysViewSettings.ViewHeaderDayFormat = "dddd"; this.Schedule.TimelineViewSettings.ViewHeaderDayFormat = "dddd"; this.Schedule.MonthViewSettings.ViewHeaderDayFormat = "dddd"
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-9)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" > <syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings ViewHeaderDayFormat = "dddd" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings ViewHeaderDayFormat = "dddd" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings ViewHeaderDayFormat = "dddd" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.summary: Gets or sets the view header template.
member.example:
The following sample used to configure the view header template. #[Xaml](#tab/tabid-10)
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:DaysViewSettings.ViewHeaderTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid Margin = "10, 0, 10, 0" > < Grid.RowDefinitions > < RowDefinition Height="*" /> <RowDefinition Height = "*" /> </ Grid.RowDefinitions > < TextBlock Foreground="Blue" Text="{Binding DayText}" /> <TextBlock Grid.Row="1" Text= "{Binding DateText}" /> </ Grid > </ DataTemplate > </ syncfusion:DaysViewSettings.ViewHeaderTemplate> </syncfusion:DaysViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.DaysViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings.ViewHeaderTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid Margin = "10, 0, 10, 0" > < Grid.RowDefinitions > < RowDefinition Height= "*" /> < RowDefinition Height= "*" /> </ Grid.RowDefinitions > < TextBlock Foreground= "Blue" Text= "{Binding DayText}" /> < TextBlock Grid.Row= "1" Foreground= "Blue" Text= "{Binding DateText}" /> </ Grid > </ DataTemplate > </ syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings.ViewHeaderTemplate> </syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings.ViewHeaderTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid> <TextBlock Foreground = "Red" Text= "{Binding DateText}" /> </ Grid > </ DataTemplate > </ syncfusion:MonthViewSettings.ViewHeaderTemplate> </syncfusion:MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: E:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.QueryAppointments
member.summary: Occurs after the visible date range changed or changed or changed. for the visible date range can be loaded in on-demand using this event.
member.remarks: Use to load the appointments in on-demand for visible date range. Loading appointments in on-demand improves the loading performance when you have appointments ranging for multiple years. Once the event is raised, will be raised. If an appointment has been added, deleted or updated within the visible date range, then the event will not be triggered. Since appointments were already loaded for that visible date range. When the is updated, the event will be raised. When the is changed, the event will be raised. The recurrence appointment should be added to the until the date of recurrence ends. If added with count or end date, you can use the method to get recurrence date collection and compare recursive dates in the current visible date range then add recurrence appointment in if recursive dates in current visible date range. If added with no end date , then recurrence appointment should be added in the when all visible date changed from the recurrence start date.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AppointmentEditorClosing
member.summary: This event occurs when the user performs the save, delete and cancel action in the appointment editor window. You can cancel or handle this event using the and properties of event argument.
member.remarks: You can cancel the appointment editor from being closed by setting the property as true. You can use the property to handle the Action in handler. For example, when user edits the appointment and clicks Save button in the appointment editor, Scheduler saves the edited values in underlying appointment. If you set Handled as true, then appointment editor will be closed, and values won’t get saved in underlying appointment. You need to write the code in handler to save the edited values in handler.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AppointmentEditorOpening
member.summary: This event occurs before the appointment editor is shown when you double-click the appointment or empty timeslot cell. Appointment Editor used to edit the appointment or to create a new appointment.
member.remarks: when the user double clicks on the appointment, this event occurs before the appointment editor is displayed to edit the tapped appointment. If user double clicks on the empty time slot, this event occurs before appointment editor is displayed to add new appointment. You can cancel the showing appointment editor by cancelling this event using .

member.name: E:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AppointmentDeleting
member.summary: This event occurs when the scheduler appointment is being deleted by pressing delete key. You can cancel the deleting operation and also decide whether to delete the series or particular occurrence when deleting occurrence of pattern appointment.
member.remarks: You can cancel the deletion of an appointment by setting the event argument property as true. When deleting appointment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AppointmentContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets the context menu that should appear whenever the context menu is requested through user interface (UI) from within appointment element.
member.remarks: opens when right click over appointment in any views. In month view, opens when is . The DataContext for the context menu is .
member.example:
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-6)
This sample shows how to bind the commands in to menu item. Command parameter of menu item should bound to context menu's data context when using the commands in .
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentContextMenu> <ContextMenu> <MenuItem Command="{Binding Source={x:Static Member=syncfusion:SchedulerCommands.Edit}}" CommandParameter="{Binding}" CommandTarget="{Binding ElementName=schedule}" Header="Edit"/> </ContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>
*** #[Xaml](#tab/tabid-7)
Below example shows how to bind the command in the data context of . The is the DataContext for , So you can bind the command in data context of scheduler by using as below.
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentContextMenu> <ContextMenu> <MenuItem Command="{Binding Path=Scheduler.DataContext.MenuCommand}" Header="Header"/> </ContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>
In above examples, is passed as command parameter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.CellContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets the context menu that should appear whenever the context menu is requested through user interface (UI) from within timeslot cell, month cell and all-day panel.
member.remarks: The DataContext for the context menu is .
member.example:
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-8)
This sample shows how to bind the commands in to menu item. Command parameter of menu item should bound to context menu's data context when using the commands in .
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.CellContextMenu> <ContextMenu> <MenuItem Command="{Binding Source={x:Static Member=syncfusion:SchedulerCommands.Add}}" CommandParameter="{Binding}" CommandTarget="{Binding ElementName=schedule}" Header="Add"/> </ContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.CellContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>
*** #[Xaml](#tab/tabid-9)
Below example shows how to bind the command in the data context of . The is the DataContext for , So you can bind the command in data context of scheduler by using as below.
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.CellContextMenu> <ContextMenu> <MenuItem Command="{Binding Path=Scheduler.DataContext.MenuCommand}" Header="Header"/> </ContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.CellContextMenu> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>
In above examples, is passed as command parameter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AllowViewNavigation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current view should navigate to the respective day or timeline day view on clicking a month cell or a date in the view header of the following views: week, work week, month agenda, timeline week, timeline work week and timeline month views.
member.remarks: AllowViewNavigation is not applicable in day and timeline day views and if is true in month view, the month view should navigate to the day view by single tapping on the agenda date view header, otherwise the month view should navigate to the day view by single tapping on the month cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.ShowDatePickerButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the date picker when the scheduler header date is clicked. The date picker will be used for quick date navigation in the . It also shows today's navigation button on header view.
member.remarks: DatePicker will not be shown if is specified other than "GregorianCalendar".
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-63)
this.Schedule.ShowDatePickerButton = true;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-64)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" ShowDatePickerButton="True"> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AllowedViewTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the that will be displayed on the header for quick navigation.
member.remarks: The will be restricted based on the . For example, the AllowedViewTypes given as Day, Week, WorkWeek, and if the ViewType given as Month, this will be reset to AllowedViewTypes first value. If is then the scheduler allows view navigation for all the scheduler views by using the keyboard keys . If AllowedViewTypes is given, then the keyboard keys will be restricted to the given allowed view types.
member.example:
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-61)
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" AllowedViewTypes="Month,Day,Week" > </syncfusion:SfScheduler>
#[C#](#tab/tabid-62)
this.Schedule.AllowedViewTypes = AllowedSchedulerViewTypes.TimelineMonth | AllowedSchedulerViewTypes.Week | AllowedSchedulerViewTypes.WorkWeek | AllowedSchedulerViewTypes.TimelineDay | (AllowedSchedulerViewTypes.TimelineWeek & ~AllowedSchedulerViewTypes.Day) ;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.CalendarIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the calendar system to use.

remarks.para: FlowDirection will be updated based on the and if you want to override this behavior set FlowDirection after .
All calendar types are supported except JapaneseCalendar, JulianCalendar and Lunar type calendars .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.ResourceGroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type specifying whether the dates should be grouped under resource or resources should be grouped within a date.
member.value: None if the appointments are not grouped based on resources. The default value is Resource. Resources can be added to the scheduler by setting the property as Resource in . Need to set the Id, Name, Foreground and Background properties of to create a resource. Add the resource to the scheduler by using the property of SfScheduler and you can also add or remove the scheduler resources dynamically.
member.remarks: Scheduler supports displaying appointments in day, week, workweek and timeline views based on resources. Month view shows resource-based appointments without grouping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.ResourceMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets object that denotes the mapping of properties to the data source fields. class contains a set of properties whose names are similar to the properties of .
member.remarks: Custom resource class should contain a mandatory field for resource Id. For dynamic changes, custom resource should inherit from INotifyPropertyChanged. property is used to get the details of custom data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.AppointmentEditFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating appointment operation to be handle.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-15)
this.Schedule.AppointmentEditFlag = AppointmentEditFlag.Add | AppointmentEditFlag.Resize;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-16)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" AppointmentEditFlag="Add,DragDrop""> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.HeaderDateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a header date format of . The default header format is MMMM yyyy.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-17)
this.Schedule.HeaderDateFormat = "MMM/yyyy";
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-18)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" HeaderDateFormat="MMM/yyyy"> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.TimeZone
member.summary: Gets or sets a time zone for the schedule control to create appointments in various time zones and displays the appointments on any time zones customer wants.
member.value: Time zone can be used in following scenarios. Create appointments in different time zones. Display appointments based on the client’s time zone. Display appointments based on scheduler time zone. Display appointments at the same time everywhere regardless of client’s time zone.
member.remarks: If the recurring appointment is converted to another time zone, then the whole sequence will be recalculated according to the new time zone information. If all-day appointment created, its start time and end time will be set to 12 AM and 12 AM by default, So time zone is not applicable for all-day appointments. Scheduler supports daylight saving time. TimeZone can be used for custom appointments by mapping the and custom properties of .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.HeaderHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to customize the header height of the scheduler.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-20)
this.Schedule.HeaderHeight = 100;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-21)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" HeaderHeight="100" > </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.ViewType
member.summary: Gets or sets the built in views such day, week, workweek, timeline and month view of the SfScheduler.
member.value: The default view mode is . It allows users to easily select and navigate between all built-in views.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-22)
this.Schedule.ViewType = SchedulerViewType.Week;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-23)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" ViewType="Week" > </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

members.member:
Gets or sets the display date to programmatically navigate the dates in . .
Date navigation before the will be reset to the scheduler minimum date and date navigation beyond the will be rest to the scheduler maximum date.
The code below sets the DisplayDate to Scheduler #[C#](#tab/tabid-24)
this.Schedule.DisplayDate = new DateTime(2020, 07, 05, 10, 0, 0);
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-25)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" DisplayDate="2020-07-05 10:0:0"> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.ShowBusyIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the busy indicator.
member.remarks: You might start and stop the animation before and after the appointments loaded with , . You might stop the animation if is set to True after loaded into view.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-27)
this.Schedule.ShowBusyIndicator = true;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-28)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" ShowBusyIndicator="True"> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.MinimumDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum display date for scheduler to restrict the visible dates.
member.remarks: The dates before minimum date will be disabled in UI and built-in navigation options are disabled to navigate beyond minimum date. Also, navigation and selection before minimum and beyond maximum dates using is not possible. Selection before minimum dates and beyond maximum dates using the is not possible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.MaximumDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum display date for scheduler to restrict the visible dates.
member.remarks: The dates after maximum date will be disabled in UI and built-in navigation options are disabled to navigate beyond maximum date. Also, navigation and selection before minimum and beyond maximum dates using is not possible. Selection after maximum dates and before minimum dates using the is not possible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SfScheduler.FirstDayOfWeek

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentControl.firstTouchTime
member.summary: Gets or sets first touch time to start the appointment dragging on TouchMove by comparing touch down and holding time.
member.remarks: As IsManipulationEnabled handled for parent , TouchMove event would not be triggered on AppointmentControl, so maintained to start appointment dragging on parent touch move by comparing touch down and holding time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentMapping.ReminderMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets the reminder data object mapping to the of the appointment. The ReminderMapping class contains a set of properties whose names are similar to the properties declared within the scheduler reminder class.

example.para: The following code snippets used to configure the custom appointment and reminder.
example.code: <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" ViewType="Week" ItemsSource="{Binding Meetings}"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentMapping> <syncfusion:AppointmentMapping Subject = "EventName" StartTime="From" EndTime="To" AppointmentBackground="BackgroundColor" Foreground="ForegroundColor" Reminders="Reminders"> <syncfusion:AppointmentMapping.ReminderMapping> <syncfusion:ReminderMapping ReminderTimeInterval = "TimeInterval" IsDismissed="Dismissed"/> </syncfusion:AppointmentMapping.ReminderMapping> </syncfusion:AppointmentMapping> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.AppointmentMapping> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentEditorOpeningEventArgs.AppointmentEditorOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets an AppointmentEditorOptions that can be treated as a bit field. It is a set of flags that determines the visibility of editors in the for the fields.
member.remarks: The default value is If the AppointmentEditorOptions value is All, it will display all the editors. If the AppointmentEditorOptions value is Reminder it will display basic editors such as subject, location, start and end date along with Reminder editor. If the AppointmentEditorOptions value is AppointmentEditorOptions.All | ~AppointmentEditorOptions.Reminder , only reminder editor alone will not be displayed. If the AppointmentEditorOptions value is AppointmentEditorOptions.All | (~AppointmentEditorOptions.Reminder amp ~AppointmentEditorOptions.Resource) ,only reminder and resource editor will not be displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.Appointment
member.summary: Gets the appointment being resized.
member.remarks: When occurrence appointment of pattern appointment is resizing , it holds the occurrence appointment details. You can get the pattern appointment details from the occurrence appointment by using the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.Action
member.summary: Gets the current action being performed while resizing an appointment.

remarks.para: You can handle resizing event using CanContinueResize and CanCommit properties based on Action property in event argument.

item.description: Denotes event occurred when user mouse over the appointment to resize an appointment (before showing resize cursor). You can cancel appointment resizing for an appointment by setting CanContinueResize property as false. Setting CanCommit property won’t have any effect when Action is Starting.

Denotes event occurred when user resizing an appointment. You can control resizing of an appointment based on StartTime and EndTime and by setting CanContinueResize property as false. Setting CanCommit property won’t have any effect when Action is Progressing.

Denotes event occurred when user ends the resizing by releasing pointer. After this event start time and end time of an appointment getting updated. You can set CanCommit property as false and handle updating Appointment StartTime and EndTime in application level. Setting CanContinueResize property won’t have any effect when Action is Committing.

Denotes the event occurred before cancelling resize operation when user press Esc key when resizing operation in progress. Resizing operation by can be continued by setting CanContinue property as True. Otherwise, appointment gets reset to original state or update based resized time based on CanCommit property. Setting CanCommit property won’t have any effect when Action is Cancelling.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the updated start time of appointment in resizing operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.EndTime
member.summary: Gets the updated end time of appointment in resizing operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.CanContinueResize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether resizing operation should be continued or cancelled. You can set this property when Action is Starting, Progressing, Cancelling.
member.remarks: This property won’t have any effect for when Action is Committing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.CanCommit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to update underlying appointment when resizing operation is completed. You can set this property when Action is Cancelling and Committing.
member.remarks: This property won’t have any effect for when Action is Starting, Progressing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.AppointmentResizingEventArgs.Resource
member.summary: Gets the resource of an appointment under which the appointment is located.
member.remarks: property holds the data object associated with scheduler when scheduler resource created from custom data object using .

members.member: Provides data for event. .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.RecurringAppointmentBeginningEditEventArgs.EditMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to edit/delete series or occurrence when the double-tapped or delete key is pressed on the recurrence appointment. You can let the end-user handle the recurrence appointment editing option (using the built-in dialog shown in the scheduler) or define it by yourself without showing a dialog.
member.value: The default value is which shows a dialog to user to choose whether to edit/delete series or occurrence.
member.remarks: You can set this property value as or . So, dialog window will not be shown, and the appointment will get edit/delete based on the value set. If the RecurrenceEditMode value is then or will be trigger only choosing OK option when delete/edit the recurrence appointment. If the RecurrenceEditMode value is or then or will be triggered directly when delete/edit the recurrence appointment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.MonthViewSettings.AppointmentDisplayCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to define the maximum number of the appointment to be displayed in a month cell.
member.value: This property takes the value. For AppointmentDisplayCount value is 1 and month cell have more than 1 appointments, single appointment will be displayed and remaining appointments in month cell displayed in more appointments count. If an AppointmentDisplayCount value is more than one, for an example value is 3 and month cell have more than 3 appointments, 2 appointments will be displayed and remaining appointments in month cell displayed in more appointments count.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.MonthViewSettings.DateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a date format.
member.example:
The following sample used to set the date format. #[C#](#tab/tabid-1)
this.Schedule.MonthViewSettings.DateFormat = "d"
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-2)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" > <syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings DateFormat = "d" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.MonthViewSettings.AgendaViewHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the Agenda view height.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.MonthViewSettings.WeekNumberTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the week number template.
member.example:
The following sample used to configure the week number template. #[Xaml](#tab/tabid-3)
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings.WeekNumberTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Grid > <TextBlock Foreground = "Red" Text="{Binding}" VerticalAlignment="Center" HorizontalAlignment="Center"/> </Grid> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:MonthViewSettings.WeekNumberTemplate> </syncfusion:MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.MonthViewSettings.MonthCellTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the month cell template.
member.example:
The following sample used to configure month cell. #[Xaml](#tab/tabid-4)
<syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule"> <syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings> <syncfusion:MonthViewSettings.MonthCellTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Border Background = "BlueViolet" > < TextBlock x:Name="DayText" HorizontalAlignment="Center" Foreground="White" Text="{Binding DateTime.Day}"/> </Border> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:MonthViewSettings.MonthCellTemplate> </syncfusion:MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler.MonthViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.summary: The timeline appointment height.

member.summary: The timeline row auto height..

member.summary: The timeline row min height..

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.TimelineViewSettings.TimelineAppointmentHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the for Timeline view to customize the default height of Appointment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.TimelineViewSettings.RowAutoHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable row auto height adjustments when the is in a scheduler on timeline views such as , , , and based on the number of appointments present on the time slot.
member.remarks: If row auto height is enabled then the will not be considered. If resources have no appointments, then the will be considered as default row height.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-1)
this.Schedule.TimelineViewSettings.RowAutoHeight= true;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-2)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" > <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings RowAutoHeight= "True" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.TimelineViewSettings.RowMinHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to set the minimum row height when the is in a scheduler on timeline views such as , , , and .
member.value: The default value is 50 if is true.
member.remarks: If the is set to false and is set, then the default value is set to available size divided by the visible resource count value. If minimum row height is set to larger than the available row height based on the , then the will not be considered.
member.example:
#[C#](#tab/tabid-3)
this.Schedule.TimelineViewSettings.RowAutoHeight = true; this.Schedule.TimelineViewSettings.RowMinHeight= 100;
#[Xaml](#tab/tabid-4)
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <syncfusion:SfScheduler x:Name="Schedule" > <syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> <syncfusion:TimelineViewSettings RowAutoHeight = "True" RowMinHeight= "100" /> </ syncfusion:SfScheduler.TimelineViewSettings> </syncfusion:SfScheduler>

.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SchedulerReminder.IsDismissed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the reminder is dismissed.
member.remarks: When a reminder of a recurring appointment is dismissed, then the reminder is set for the next occurrence in a series.If the current occurrence is the last occurrence in a chain, the reminder is dismissed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SchedulerReminder.ReminderAlertTime
member.summary: Gets the reminder time that decides when to show a reminder alert of the appointment.
member.remarks: The appointment reminder time calculated as follows reminder time = ScheduleAppointment.ActualStartTime - ReminderTimeInterval. This reminder time interval will be updated based on the snooze time to display time in reminder alert window.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Scheduler.SchedulerReminder.Appointment
member.summary: Gets the appointment details for which the reminder is created.
member.remarks: A recurring appointment will return its occurrence of appointment.
